channel.title: Engagements on Planetary Atmospheres
channel.description: Recent content in Engagements on Planetary Atmospheres

item.title: TV and Radio
item.description: Podcasts ITN Podcast on Exoplanets (commissioned by audible.com) - recorded in Leicester on October 10th 2019. Space Boffins: recorded a discussion of future missions to the Ice Giants at the UK Space Conference, September 25th 2019.

item.title: Schools
item.description: Space School: The University of Leicester’s Space School celebrated its 30th anniversary in 2019, and I was invited to give a lecture on my planetary research to their “senior school” (16-18 year olds) in August 2019, focussing on future missions to the Ice Giants. I previously provided a lecture at the Space School 2016, on exploring giant planet atmospheres. Space School UK are loving hearing about the exciting planetary science research of @LeighFletcher!

item.title: Science Writing
item.description: Science Blogs I regularly provide scientific content for online websites, including the following: Planetary Wanderings - personal blog maintained since 2007. Leicester to Jupiter - creator of a blog at the University of Leicester to celebrate UK involvement in the Juno mission. The Conversation - including several articles on the Juno mission to Jupiter and the future exploration of Europa. Planetary Society - including Saturn’s hexagon, Jupiter’s meteorology, and Europa’s plumes.
